headline.main: Rising Iron Curtain Exposes Haunting Veil of Polluted Air

byline.original: By MARLISE SIMONS, Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: In the depths of a salt mine in Poland, men, women and children lie in bed, bundled in coats and tugging at heavy blankets. In an upside-down world, they have come to this underground clinic to breathe clean and healing air.
